text.section: In this section, "safety violation" means a condition or activity likely to cause injury or harm to an individual or property.
This section does not apply to a safety violation by a gas company that is subject to § 13-203 of this subtitle.

section.section: Subject to paragraph (2) of this subsection, a public service company that violates a provision of this division that relates to safety is subject to a civil penalty not exceeding $25,000 for each violation for each day that the violation persists.
For a common carrier, the maximum civil penalty may not exceed $500 for each violation or related series of violations stemming from a single safety inspection.

text.section: The public service company involved may request reconsideration of a penalty imposed under this section within 30 days after the date of notification of the determination.
